meanings.definition: Logs suitable for sawing into lumber.
meanings.sent1: The sawlogs were stacked neatly by the sawmill.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter ordered a truckload of sawlogs for his next project.
meanings.sent3: Why did the sawlogs go to school? To get a little 'saw'-dust-ry education!
meanings.sent4: The forest whispered secrets as the sawlogs were carried away.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh sawlogs filled the air, promising new furniture to come.

meanings.sent1: The lumberjack sawlogs every morning to prepare for the day's work.
meanings.sent2: She sawlogs with precision, ensuring each piece was of the perfect size.
meanings.sent3: Why did the tree refuse to be sawlogs? It didn't want to be 'stumped'!
meanings.sent4: The old barn was sawlogs into pieces, ready to be repurposed.
meanings.sent5: The sound of sawing echoed through the forest as the logger sawlogs for hours.
